result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamekia Doritha Cotton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Must obtain GED or HSED. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamekia Doritha Cotton

records.addlTxt: DOC-notice of court ordered financial obligations status - balance due on court ordered financial obligations $479.00.  Defendant due to discharge 03/20/2018.

records.addlTxt: Def does not plan to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Jamekia Doritha Cotton in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Request a COP date.
BTC: Adj  Plea hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jamekia Doritha Cotton in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Request another status date.
BTC: Adjourn. Report to ZCI after court to test. If the test is negative will be addressing bond at the next hearing.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jamekia Doritha Cotton in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  W. Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Status conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jamekia Doritha Cotton in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jamekia Doritha Cotton in court.  Randall L Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
Defendant would like time to obtain counsel. 
BTC: Matter is adjourned.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
